igbo: Egbe belu, ugo belu. Nke si ibe ya ebela, nku kwa ya.
english: Let the kite perch and let the eagle perch. Whichever says the other should not perch, may its wings break.

igbo: A na-agwa ntị ma ntị anụghị, e gburu isi ntị esoro ya.
english: When advice is given to the ear and the ear refuses to listen, when the head is cut off, the ear follows.

igbo: Ihe onye metere ya ga-ata ya.
english: Whatever a person does will come back to them.

igbo: O bu onye nwe ya na-ebu ya.
english: It is the owner that carries their own burden.

igbo: Okwu a tụụrụ n'ụlọ ka e jiri mara dike n'agha.
english: The words spoken at home are what is used to judge a warrior in battle.

igbo: Nwata bulie nna ya elu, ogodo ya ana ada.
english: When a child lifts up their father, their own cloth falls off.

igbo: Onye buru chi ya ụzọ, ọ gbagbue onwe ya n'ụzọ.
english: Whoever goes before their god, destroys themselves on the way.

igbo: A sị na agwọ gbalụo ogwu, ọ gaghị egbu ya.
english: If a snake runs away from medicine, it will not be killed by it.

igbo: Onye na-amaghị ebe mmiri bidoro mawa ya, ama ama ya agwụla.
english: He who does not know where the rain began to beat him, will not know where it dried his body.

igbo: A kpụkpọrọ akpụkpọ, a mara onye nwe ya.
english: When a skin is flayed, the owner is known.

igbo: Onye kwe, chi ya ekwe.
english: When someone agrees, their personal god agrees as well.

igbo: Nku di na mba, obughi kwa nri.
english: Firewood from another land does not cook food.

igbo: Otu mkpuru osisi anaghị emebe ọhịa.
english: A single tree does not make a forest.

igbo: E mee nwata ka e mee okenye, obi adị ya mma.
english: When a child is treated like an elder, they are pleased.

igbo: Ihe ojoo anaghi agba ọsọ ọsọ; ọ na-eche onye gbara ọsọ.
english: Evil does not run in haste; it waits for the one who runs.

igbo: Ihe a hụrụ n'anya, ọ naghị eri onye ahụ ahu.
english: What is loved does not consume the one who loves it.

igbo: Nwata kụrụ aka n’ala, o kwuru nkịta, ọ kpọrọ nna ya.
english: When a child strikes the ground, he challenges a dog and calls his father.

igbo: E jiri mara dike n’agha, ọ bụ n’ụlọ ka a kpara ya.
english: A warrior is judged in battle, but shaped at home.

igbo: Agbọghọ na-akọ nrọ, o chere na ọ bụ eziokwu.
english: When a maiden dreams, she thinks it is reality.

igbo: O ji aka ya gbaa ọkpọ, ọkpọ agbagbue ya.
english: He who beats the drum with his own hands is the one it deafens.

igbo: Onye rụrụ arụ sị na chi ya adịghị, chi ya atụpụ ya.
english: He who blames his god for laziness is abandoned by that god.

igbo: Ụra na-eju afọ, ụra anaghị eju obi.
english: Sleep satisfies the stomach, but never satisfies the heart.

igbo: Mmiri mara onye nwe ya.
english: Water knows its owner.

igbo: Ọ bụrụ na e nweghị ifufe, ahịhịa anaghị agba ọsọ.
english: If there is no wind, the grass does not move.

igbo: Onye na-azụ nwa ajọ anụ, mgbe o toro, ọ na-ata ya.
english: He who rears a wild animal will be bitten when it grows.

igbo: Onye ji igu ka e ji ama dike.
english: The one who has endurance is the true warrior.

igbo: Onye kwe ka e kpo ya ajọ ihe, ọ na-efu ezigbo aha ya.
english: He who allows himself to be called evil loses his good name.

igbo: Ọnụ kwuru okwu, obi adị ya mma.
english: The mouth that speaks relieves the heart.

igbo: Agbọghọ kpọrọ nwoke nkịtị, ọ na-ata ahụhụ mgbe e mesịrị.
english: The maiden who despises a humble man suffers later.

igbo: Ihe a na-ahụ n’anya bụ ihe na-agba ọsọ.
english: What one loves is always fleeting.

igbo: O jiri ogologo ụkwụ gbaa ọsọ, mgbe o ruru, o zuo ike.
english: He who runs with long legs will eventually rest.

igbo: Otu aka rụọ, ọ naghị arụ ọrụ zuru ezu.
english: One hand alone cannot do complete work.

igbo: A na-amaghị onye ga-ata anụ ọhịa ruo mgbe e gbuuru ya.
english: No one knows who will eat the wild animal until it is killed.

igbo: Nwoke anaghị agba ọsọ n’efu; ihe na-achụ ya na-achụkwa ihe.
english: A man does not run for nothing; what pursues him is also being pursued.

igbo: Okwu anaghị agba aka mgba.
english: Words do not wrestle with fists.

igbo: Onye fee eze, eze eruo ya.
english: He who serves a king will eventually become one.

igbo: Ọtụtụ mmadụ anaghị eme ka eziokwu bụrụ ụgha.
english: The multitude cannot turn truth into falsehood.

igbo: Agadi nwanyị anaghi agba ọsọ n’efu; e nwere ihe na-achụ ya n’azụ.
english: An old woman does not run in vain; something must be after her.

igbo: O buru na ị naghị eri mkpụrụ osisi n’ụlọ, ọ pụtara na ị naghị akwọ ya.
english: If you do not eat fruits at home, it means you did not plant them.

igbo: Onye na-eso oke gbaa ọsọ na-enweghị ihe, ọ ga-agwụ ike n’efu.
english: He who follows a rat without cause will tire himself for nothing.
